data.title: Always great
data.text: A great place to have breakfast... huge selection, huge portions, and huge value.  Nothing fancy, but everything great.

data.title: Generous Portions for Breakfast
data.text: I happened to be in town and was looking for a place to have breakfast.  I saw the reviews about Dean's and thought I would give it a try.  Dean's is located on Main St in Pleasanton.  It looks like an old fashion diner when you step inside.  There are two rooms with booths lining the walls and tables in the center.  The waitress was attentive and friendly.  When I got the menu, I was amazed at the selection of omelets (3 pages)!  Anything you could think of.  I didn't bring a big enough apetite for a 3 or 4 egg omelet so I settled for 2 eggs over easy,sourdough toast (dry) and hash browns.  The eggs were cooked to order and the toast came without butter which doesn't always happen at other restaurants.  The hash browns were a bit too greasy for me.  Their coffee is delicious!  I would definitely recommend Dean's for breakfast.  I happened to go on a weekday so there was no problem getting seated, but I can imagine how hard it must be to get a seat on the weekends!  I would definitely stop by again when I'm in town.

data.title: Great omelets for breakfast
data.text: We tried Dean's because my grandsons love to go there. The omelet menu is so immense it's over-whelming.  So, the waitress suggested we tell her what we wanted and they made them to order!  Delicious. Big portions too.

data.title: Great breakfasts
data.text: I used to have my office a block away and would come in for breakfast at least once a week. The decor had seen better days, but the food is why I went, and I why I kept going back. At first I varied my breakfasts, but after a month or so, I settled on omlettes and that's mostly what I had for the next few years. They were that good.

data.title: Great American Breakfasts
data.text: WAnt a good diner?  This is the place; great american food and lots of it (breakfasts only). Love the omelets.

data.title: Old fashioned and old cafe.
data.text: Not pretentious as most places in town. A nice alternative. Simple comfort food. Too bad the quálity is not better.

data.title: Omelettes Galore
data.text: I've never seen so many types of omelettes in my life.  You think about it and they have it.  Excellent place for breakfast or brunch.  And they give you a mountain of food.

data.title: Excellent food in a tireless diner!
data.text: This food is awesome. I have eaten breakfast and lunch here and it was fantastic. The servings are large, the food is fresh and hot, and you better see the bottom of your coffee cup because the service is excellent!  Their specialty is omelets but everything they serve is great!  Sometimes you have to wait awhile to get in but the reward comes as soon as you are seated. Do yourself a favor, go to Dean's to eat!

data.title: Iconic, dated, but large portions, known for omelets
data.text: Old dive diner, with uneven floors, duct tape on the booth seats, an icon in Pleasanton. Omelettes, with old school hash browns, and buttery toast. Omelettes, are done the burrito style way, so I've had one or two, which were still runny inside. Not a big fan of runny eggs. Parking not a problem, sometimes a line out the door, and most of the servers, are not the chatty type. I worked, lived in Pleasanton, but never became a big fan. Your call, still an old iconic place, right on Main St., which you may want to visit, in Pleasanton.

data.title: Wonderful breakfast location
data.text: My sister and I stopped in for a late breakfast. What a good decision. This place has the most amazing omlets and their hash browns are delicious. Not only do they have great tasting omlets, but they are more than enough in portion size and they have so many to choose from, something will certainly suit your fancy.

data.title: Great hole in the wall breakfast
data.text: Do you like those hole in the wall breakfast places that all the locals go to? If you do, you will like Dean's Cafe. I have eaten there a few times - great breakfast. I only gave them 4 stars because the atmosphere is rather dismal and out dated (paneling on the walls) but the food is great! Huge selection of Omelets. I an avacado bacon omelet with Swiss cheese - very fresh - very good. Lots of food for the money.

data.title: fun spot
data.text: although it is dated it is a landmark and very fun. The trivia pamphlets  on the tables are cool too. the food is HUGE and the prices are good. The service is friendly, though when it is crowded it can be slow, ( that is what the trivia is for ) Check it out it is a cool little spot. Try the Reuben sandwich.. Fantastic. also they have like 200 types of omelettes . Just a great spot. Enjoy!

data.title: Great omeletes!
data.text: Very good omeletes but HUGH!  Also $11.95 each, but great. Atmosphere a little rustic but everyone pleasant and appears to be frequented by locals.

data.title: An incredible family breakfast right on Main Street!
data.text: We decided to go to Dean's for a family breakfast. There was eight in our party. We not only received incredible service, but the food was to die for!  It was fresh, hot, and made to our request as we had a few substitutions. We didn't go for a healthy meal; we wanted a traditional breakfast. We could have been a group of hungry loggers and left satisfied!  The portions were huge, the food was hot and fresh, and the service was incredible!  We will definitely return to Dean's in the future!  What a great experience!

data.title: Family Chistmas Breakfast
data.text: Eight of us for family breakfast, seated immediately (we did  have reservation) Everyone enjoyed their breakfast.  Very cold morning and the waitress even offered to bring an electric heater.

data.title: Downtown Pleasanton Classic
data.text: Deans cafe has been serving the Pleasanton area for decades. Its really an anchor in  downtown area. Good food, great portions and best known for its breakfasts including a wide variety of omelets classic breakfast fare. Lunches are great also and a great place to meet for lunch as its centrally located and all the locals know where it is located.

data.title: First visit
data.text: A little run down but the food was very good. Kitchen takes a while but worth the wait. Waitress made some great recommendations.

data.title: It would have been nice to get food after 55 minutes!
data.text:
Stopped in before Sunday church. We had an hour and a hLf to burn. We ordered an omelette to split and 55 minutes later has no food. We had to leave and felt bad for the waitress. She said no charge on the coffee left her a couple of bucks anyway.

Pretty sad when you can't produce an omelette in an hour on a Sunday.

data.title: Not fancy, but a local favorite
data.text: Dean's is an old time breakfast joint. Been here for years and years. Not fancy but the locals love the breakfast. Have never had anything but breakfast here and always had a good meal. Not fancy to look at but it was here in 1979 when we first arrived and still here in 2015. That says something.

data.title: ANY type omelette you want
data.text: I've been going to Dean's Cafe since I was a kid.  They've expanded since then but still has the same feel.  If you want an omelette, any type of omelette, I mean ANY type of omelette, they have it.  The menu alone has nearly 300 types spelled out and you can mix and match with all the ingredients.  On top of that they have typical breakfast faire.  They open early and close at 2:30.  Excellent breakfasts.
